lexUnit.name: imagine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form a mental image or concept of.

sentence.text: Next time she had a nightmare , she would try imagining smashing , like eggs , the faceless looters and killers of her dreams .
And similarly we can imagine constant electric and magnetic fields .
I kept imagining coming up to London to see you .
She imagined living alone in Sea House , being quite old .
She had always imagined drug-pushing to be a male-dominated business and had been surprised when the prim-looking blonde in a navy blue duffel coat had approached her .
` You can imagine just how difficult that might be , to deceive New York State Police , " said Mr Curtis .
It was for war charities but can you imagine anything more barbarous ? "
Imagine feeling foolish , and a crowd of people laughing at you .
Somehow he had imagined it larger , more forbidding .
It 's difficult to imagine a room more sumptuous than our Brunei Suite .
He could imagine her fighting to hold her own in the orphanage instead of letting herself become meek and mousy .
He could not imagine her living anywhere else but in Wychwood Forest .
Can you imagine the pandemonium we caused ?
The factory runs from 8.30 in the morning until 10 at night , so you can imagine the quantity of strings these people are putting out .
He liked to imagine himself an academic , working after dinner in one of those elegant book-lined rooms of an Oxford college .
But let us go further and imagine a world without ` steam radio " and ` talking pictures " .
She said , ` Apart from anything else I ca n't imagine any sex worth giving up tea-time for . "
It was quite possible to imagine Mrs Kovacks as a femme fatale , discarded husband and all ; but Amy Smithers was a different kettle of fish .
Why had she never imagined Bella as a redhead ?
He imagines himself as the only adult in a large field of rye , standing by the edge of a cliff .
Now imagine yourself once again in the room you love .
Let us imagine a very clear-cut situation in which the power of the sender over the receiver is considerable : an army sergeant speaking to a private just before parade .
It 's frightening to imagine John Walters on ginseng .
I can hardly imagine her dropping in on Alexander at any time , far less occasionally .
Imagine him appealing to America to come in quickly , fight the good fight with us , shoulder to shoulder .
Maggie woke up imagining it to be morning , only to discover it was still dark .
` One would almost imagine you to be jealous . "
Your generation will be the key to shaping the new Europe and seizing the new opportunities that could not be imagined during the Cold War .
` It is commonly enough imagined that earthquakes and volcanic eruptions are two faces of the same coin .
But is there anything which can be imagined as existing in isolation and as possessing great value in such a case ?
It might be imagined by those who are not themselves Anglican that the habit of ` going to confession " is limited only to markedly ` High " churches , but this is not necessarily the case .
Most of the ` masters " of torture said that they had been fighting a desperate unseen war , whose atmosphere could not be imagined by people from democracies .
We created works of art that could not even be imagined by lesser races ; we pushed our bodies even further and devised whole new theories and systems to improve our way of life .
What on earth made me imagine for even one second that I would have enough strength to confront Luke ?
You 'd have imagined from all the interest on his face that I was trying to sell him my butterfly collection .
Do n't imagine for one moment that most college students are intellectual " egg-heads ' -- and that you are the exception .
Tomorrow we are holding a party in our bungalow , which has room for about 60 people , and I imagine about that number may come .
I imagine by that you mean the new censorship categories from the British Board of Film Censors ?
I was too young to know anything of sexual images , but I used to imagine all the local ladies tied to trees . "
You imagine we do n't know who they are ?
I imagine I was holding my trombone case , kicking at the loose pebbles in the roadway .
She imagined herself reunited with Nick through the cat 's agency , as lovers might be in some fairy story .
You can not imagine how furious I was .
Trouble was I could never run very quickly , and I can not imagine what I would have done if I had been chased by the bull .
I can not imagine how this discussion would go , can you ?
` If those are tracks , " she said , ` imagine what the things themselves must be like . "
I liked to imagine that the tradition of free love had never died .
Moreover , is it possible to imagine that anyone who dissected an eye could think that it contained fire ?
` I can well imagine that you do not wish to leave here until you have proof .
It is difficult for us to imagine the characteristics of wines described by critics writing a mere generation ago , let alone those of wines described centuries ago .
It would be hard to imagine a more complex and bewildering environment for an adolescent to grow up in .
In other words , imagine a machine that can look ahead one move .
So at least that 's all right : now we can go ahead and confidently imagine the sunset .
She had never imagined being forced into confidence with such brutal suddenness .
Imagine being told that you have cancer .
I can imagine looking like this , having this image , until I 'm forty .
` Poor her , " said Lydia , but as she could not imagine taking care of a disruptive child she could n't truly sympathise .
Canetti , for example , could n't imagine writing for money .
What intrigued me was their mutual indifference to an activity I 'd always imagined to be both intimate and passionate .
They are the last people on earth one could imagine to be dancers .
` I went on a submarine trip when I was 16 , and it was the greatest thing I could imagine then to serve my country in a submarine .
